page.title: 08LOCAL HISTORY
page.content:
Interview continued.
In the fields the rabbits used to run out of the way of the horse and plough and men used to stay up very late to catch them to eat. Children used to stay up until 10 o'clock to watch and they used to play hide and seek in the bales. The children at school had slate pencils. They used to knit and sew a lot and embroidered clothes. Each child brought their own potato to school for their lunch as there was no school kitchen to provide a meal. They would chalk their name on their potato and it would be placed close to the big iron stove to cook. The children took turns to pump water for use in the school.
